intro: Serjania hebecarpa f. amblycephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed serjania, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil. It belongs to the family Serjania, which includes shrubs and trees characterized by their showy, often red or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
